entries.title: Felipe Calderón, Former Mexican President, Accused of Supporting Sinaloa Cartel
entries.description: The accusation, which was quickly denied, was made by a former Mexican official at the trial in Brooklyn of Mexico’s former top security chief.

entries.title: Russia Pays a Bloody Price for Small Gains in Eastern Ukraine
entries.description: Russia is relying on masses of troops to overrun Ukrainian positions, producing heavy casualties and incremental gains.

entries.title: Rescue Teams in Turkey and Syria Quake Fight Weather as Deaths Top 7,700
entries.description: Shoveling snow and rubble, emergency crews worked across hundreds of miles in Turkey and Syria to save people in the aftermath of the most powerful quake in the region in decades.

entries.title: Mukarram Jah, Heir to an Opulent Throne He Abandoned, Dies at 89
entries.description: He descended from famed Islamic royalty in India and Turkey, but later fled to Australia and became a sheep farmer.

entries.title: Joy and Heartache Follow Earthquake Rescue in Turkish City of Gaziantep
entries.description: A couple and their twin sons were freed from the rubble of a collapsed building in Gaziantep, near the quake’s epicenter. But two other boys could not be found.

entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Quake’s Death Toll Soars
entries.description: Also, China’s balloon spin and Russia’s mounting losses.

entries.title: At Cooper Union, a Russian Design Show Caught in a Political Crossfire
entries.description: After indefinitely postponing a modest student exhibit about the Russian equivalent to the Bauhaus, the school received protests from 750 academics. On Monday, it reinstated the show.

entries.title: As Sunak Tries to Move Ahead, He’s Haunted by Prime Ministers Past
entries.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak of Britain made moves to recharge his government, but he is being harried by Liz Truss and Boris Johnson, who are not fading away.

entries.title: 3 E.U. Countries Plan to Get Some Leopard 1 Tanks to Ukraine ‘Within Months’
entries.description: The new initiative aims to boost Kyiv’s supply of tanks faster as more advanced tanks will take many months to arrive.

entries.title: Erdogan’s Response to Turkey’s Earthquake Could Determine His Re-Election
entries.description: The Turkish president swept to power two decades ago after the government botched its response to a 1999 earthquake. Monday’s quake adds to his challenges an election just a few months away.

entries.title: Pentagon Lifts Trump-Era Ban on Release of Guantánamo Prisoners’ Art
entries.description: The Trump administration called detainee art U.S. government property and halted most releases. Lawyers never mounted an intellectual property case.

entries.title: Only Border Crossing for U.N. Aid from Turkey to Syria Is Hobbled
entries.description: As the Syrian government tightly controls what aid it allows into opposition-held areas, border crossings with Turkey have been a lifeline.

entries.title: Soccer Player Christian Atsu Is Rescued From Turkey Earthquake
entries.description: Just hours before Christian Atsu was trapped, he had scored the winning goal for the Turkish soccer club Hatayspor.

entries.title: Serial Rapist David Carrick, a Former U.K. Police Officer, Is Sentenced to Life
entries.description: David Carrick had pleaded guilty to 49 crimes against 12 women in the latest case to cast a harsh spotlight on the Metropolitan Police.

entries.title: Zelensky Could Leave Ukraine to Visit EU Leaders in Brussels
entries.description: The Ukrainian president’s possible visit to the Belgian capital, where he would likely address the European Parliament, hinges on security arrangements.

entries.title: Searching for Survivors
entries.description: Time is running out and cold weather is impeding the search for survivors after a major earthquake hit Turkey.

entries.title: Live Updates: Rescuers Work in Freezing Conditions as Quake Death Toll Exceeds 5,000 in Turkey and Syria
entries.description: At least 16,000 emergency workers were combing through the rubble on Tuesday. The death toll is expected to rise further.

entries.title: Zelensky May Go to Brussels as He Navigates E.U. Political Support
entries.description: A possible trip by Ukraine’s president to meet European Union leaders in Brussels on Thursday hinges on security arrangements.

entries.title: In a First, South Korea Is Ordered to Compensate a Vietnam War Victim
entries.description: A court ruling held that South Korean troops were responsible for a civilian massacre that killed more than 70 villagers in Vietnam during the war.

entries.title: China Tries to Play Down Balloon Dispute With Censorship and Memes
entries.description: Chinese propaganda also appears to be walking a fine line: looking tough for the crowd at home, without further derailing relations with the United States.

entries.title: The Lone Link for Aid Between Syria and Turkey Is Not Usable After the Quake
entries.description: Syria is not able to receive direct aid from many countries because of sanctions, so the border crossing has been a lifeline.

entries.title: ‘Miracle’ Cystic Fibrosis Drug Kept Out of Reach in Developing Countries
entries.description: Vertex Pharmaceuticals is not making its drug, Trikafta, available in poorer countries, where thousands of diagnosed patients stand to benefit.

entries.title: The People Onscreen Are Fake. The Disinformation Is Real.
entries.description: For the first time, A.I.-generated personas, often used for corporate trainings, were detected in a state-aligned information campaign — opening a new chapter in online manipulation.

entries.title: Turkey Earthquake: Time Is Running Out to Find Survivors
entries.description: Rescues typically happen within three days of an earthquake, an expert said. The logistics of finding survivors in Turkey and Syria are daunting.

entries.title: The Quest to Find Rectangles in a Square
entries.description: A puzzle posted in an online community unlocked a wormhole within the basic shape.

entries.title: One Turkish Apartment Tower Collapsed in The Earthquake, While Those Around It Did Not
entries.description: Rescue workers listened for signs of survivors in the rubble as residents wondered why their homes had not fallen.

entries.title: The U.S. aid agency deploys two search and rescue teams to Turkey.
entries.description: The two units, based in Virginia and California, are the only such teams in the United States that work internationally. They join the thousands of  rescuers from Syria and Turkey already there.

entries.title: Monday’s quake is one of the deadliest this century. The toll is expected to rise.
entries.description: Officials in both Syria and Turkey expect the death toll to rise significantly as rescuers make their way through devastated cities.

entries.title: How Russia Is Surviving the Tightening Grip on Its Oil Revenue
entries.description: Europe’s and America’s gradual restrictions on Russian oil trade are raising the stakes in a protracted economic standoff that is reshaping the global energy market.

entries.title: How to Help Earthquake Victims in Turkey and Syria
entries.description: Here’s how to contribute to organizations that are aiding the rescue and recovery efforts in Turkey and Syria.

entries.title: Another Chinese Balloon Flew Over Colombia, Officials Confirm
entries.description: The Chinese government said the balloon that Colombia spotted in its airspace on Friday was for civilian purposes and was being used for flight tests.

entries.title: Powerful Quake Strikes Turkey and Syria, Killing More Than 4,300
entries.description: Desperate survivors dug through rubble with shovels and their bare hands, hoping to find loved ones.

entries.title: Humanitarian Crisis in Syria Is Exacerbated By Deadly Earthquakes
entries.description: One of the hardest hit areas was northwestern Syria, where nearly three million people displaced by the country’s decade-long civil war were already living in precarious conditions.

entries.title: Eastern Ukraine Braces for New Russian Offensive
entries.description: The war is intensifying in a string of villages on the eastern front, where doctors struggle to handle an influx of gruesome injuries and soldiers fret about a Russian army sending waves of new conscripts.

entries.title: Kamala Harris Announces Funding to Address Migration Crisis
entries.description: The vice president said private companies had pledged almost $1 billion to support communities in Central America.
